drupalNodeEvent.title: Social Media and Social History during the Wuhan Lockdown: A Talk By Guobin Yang

field_description.processed: The sealing off of Wuhan from January 23 to April 8, 2020 was an unprecedented event in modern world history. Recently published by Columbia University Press, Guobin Yang’s THE WUHAN LOCKDOWN recounts this history by presenting a galaxy of dramatic scenes and characters. This talk introduces the main features of the book and then zooms in on one theme – the significance of social media postings in documenting and making history. During the lockdown, residents in Wuhan and beyond took to social media to document their experiences, producing large numbers of digital stories in the forms of diaries, photography, video blogs, poems, online user comments, and more. In this way, they not only created vast archives of first-hand historical records, but directly participated in the making of history.
